initial_story: musculoskeletal diseases and cognitive impairments in patients lead todifficulties in movement as well as negative effects on their psychologicalhealth. clinical gait analysis, a vital tool for early diagnosis and treatment,traditionally relies on expensive optical motion capture systems. recentadvances in computer vision and deep learning have opened the door to moreaccessible and cost-effective alternatives. this paper introduces a novelspatio-temporal transformer network to estimate critical gait parameters fromrgb videos captured by a single-view camera. empirical evaluations on a publicdataset of cerebral palsy patients indicate that the proposed frameworksurpasses current state-of-the-art approaches and show significant improvementsin predicting general gait parameters (including walking speed, gait deviationindex - gdi, and knee flexion angle at maximum extension), while utilizingfewer parameters and alleviating the need for manual feature extraction.
stories: Cardiovascular diseases and hearing impairments in elderly individuals lead to difficulties in communication as well as negative effects on their social well-being. Audiometric analysis, a crucial tool for early detection and intervention, traditionally relies on expensive sound booths and specialized equipment. Recent breakthroughs in artificial intelligence and natural language processing have opened the door to more accessible and cost-effective alternatives. This study introduces a novel multimodal fusion network to estimate critical speech parameters from audio recordings captured by a single smartphone microphone. Empirical evaluations on a public dataset of age-related hearing loss patients indicate that the proposed framework surpasses current state-of-the-art approaches and show significant improvements in predicting speech intelligibility, while utilizing fewer parameters and alleviating the need for manual transcription.

Retinal diseases and cognitive decline in older adults result in challenges in daily living activities as well as adverse impacts on their mental health. Ophthalmological examinations, a vital tool for early diagnosis and treatment, have traditionally required expensive equipment and specialized clinics. Recent advancements in machine learning and computer vision have paved the way for more affordable and accessible alternatives. This research presents a novel deep learning-based system to detect critical visual biomarkers from images captured by a single smartphone camera. Experimental results on a public dataset of age-related macular degeneration patients demonstrate that the proposed framework outperforms current state-of-the-art methods and shows significant improvements in predicting visual acuity, while reducing the need for manual grading and specialized expertise.

Cardiovascular diseases and mobility impairment in elderly individuals lead to difficulties in maintaining independence and negatively impact their overall well-being. Echocardiographic assessments, a crucial tool for early detection and intervention, have typically required costly machinery and specialized medical facilities. Recent breakthroughs in artificial intelligence and sensor technologies have enabled more cost-effective and convenient alternatives. This study introduces a novel AI-powered system to identify key cardiac biomarkers from data collected by a wearable smart device. Experimental results on a public dataset of heart failure patients show that the proposed framework surpasses current state-of-the-art methods and demonstrates significant enhancements in predicting cardiovascular risk, while minimizing the need for manual analysis and specialized knowledge.

Neurodegenerative disorders and cognitive decline in aging populations result in challenges to preserving mental acuity and compromise their quality of life. Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) examinations, a vital tool for early diagnosis and treatment, have traditionally demanded expensive equipment and specialized neurological centers. Recent advancements in machine learning and brain-computer interface technologies have made possible more affordable and accessible alternatives. This research presents a novel ML-powered platform to detect key neural biomarkers from data recorded by a non-invasive, portable neuro headset. Experimental results on a public dataset of Alzheimer's disease patients demonstrate that the proposed system outperforms current state-of-the-art methods and exhibits significant improvements in predicting cognitive decline, while reducing the need for manual interpretation and specialized expertise.

Cardiovascular diseases and physical frailty in elderly communities lead to obstacles in maintaining physical mobility and diminishing their overall well-being. Electrocardiogram (ECG) assessments, a crucial tool for early detection and intervention, have historically required sophisticated machinery and specialized cardiology centers. Recent breakthroughs in artificial intelligence and wearable technologies have enabled more cost-effective and accessible solutions. This study introduces a pioneering AI-driven system to identify critical cardiac biomarkers from data captured by a non-invasive, wearable chest strap. Experimental results on a public dataset of heart failure patients show that the proposed system surpasses current state-of-the-art methods and demonstrates substantial enhancements in predicting cardiovascular events, while minimizing the need for manual analysis and specialized knowledge.

Diabetic retinopathy and cognitive decline in aging populations pose significant challenges to preserving visual acuity and overall quality of life. Optical coherence tomography (OCT) scans, a vital tool for early diagnosis and treatment, have traditionally necessitated complex equipment and specialized ophthalmology clinics. Recent advancements in machine learning and portable imaging technologies have facilitated more affordable and convenient solutions. This research presents a groundbreaking ML-based platform to detect critical retinal biomarkers from data acquired by a non-invasive, handheld retinal camera. Experimental results on a public dataset of diabetic patients show that the proposed platform outperforms current state-of-the-art methods and demonstrates significant improvements in predicting retinal damage, while reducing the need for manual interpretation and specialized expertise.

This study introduces a pioneering AI-driven platform to identify high-risk cardiac biomarkers from data acquired by a portable, user-friendly echocardiography device. Clinical trials on a diverse cohort of patients show that the proposed platform surpasses current state-of-the-art methods and demonstrates substantial enhancements in predicting cardiovascular events, while minimizing the need for manual analysis and specialized knowledge.
